entry.title: multi_display: Remove WindowState::RestoreState
entry.content:
This cl mostly removes the WindowState::RestoreState that introduced

by crrev.com/c/4103928. As after crrev.com/c/4417085, it is only

useful when `restore_bounds_override_` is set. And that will only be

set when window horizontal/vertical maximization happens.



We are going to handle the horizontal/vertical maximization inside

DefaultState::EnterToNextState instead. The restore bounds set by

horizontal/vertical maximization will be saved/restored before/after

window state changes there.

`kRestoreBoundsKey` will be cleared on `window_state_restore_history_` instead of window state to keep them consistent.



See b/290657501 for more details.



Bug: b/290657501

Tests: WindowStateTest* and other existing tests

Change-Id: I0a6e69fb36b5fc2f58e9ecefbe54e5676055270d

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in RenderWidgetHostViewAuraOverscrollTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.





------ How the change is created ------



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

enable them on certain platforms.

But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

ones suggested by `git cl format`.





------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------



You may choose a platform you are interested,

e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]





------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.



content/test:content_unittests/RenderWidgetHostViewAuraOverscrollTest.GestureScrollDebounceTimerOverscroll

127 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

150 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

192 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel



data version: 2023-06-28 16:45:51



Bug: 1380293

entry.title: [Tracing w/SDK] Fix Java event name filtering with multiple sessions
entry.content:
Tracing config has a field for filtering package names from Java

tracing event names. Since configs are per-session, this requires

special treatment in the case of multiple parallel tracing sessions.



This CL implements the strict option: if at least one active session

has this field set, all sessions will get filtered event names.

entry.title: chromeos: Ensure display is powered on via test_runner.py
entry.content:
When a test suite like 'ozone_gl_unittests' runs on device it issues the

command 'stop ui' to stop the running chrome instance and release the

GPU lock on the display. Ensure the display stays powered on by sending

a user activity ping to powerd.



We anticipate needing this for 'chromeos_integration_tests' which will

run on hardware.



Bug: 1464750

Test: added to test_runner_test.py

Test: out_dedede/Release/bin/run_chromeos_integration_tests --board=dedede --device=localhost:2222 --enable-pixel-output-in-tests --user-data-dir=/tmp/udd --disable-mojo-broker --stop-ui --gtest_filter=AppList*

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Refactor Router override from tests
entry.content:
Simplifies how browser tests update the Router singleton instance and

set of available routes. Instead of overriding a specific route object

or needing to create the set of routes manually, only a single function

`createRouterForTesting()` needs to be called to create the set of

routes and a new Router instance.

entry.title: [CR2023] Clean up UI in page info dialog.
entry.content:
Few more UI changes to the page info dialog for Chrome Refresh 2023.



1) Spacing between icons shrink from 12 to 8.

3) Text on labels will use body style 1.

entry.title: [infra] More closely unify variant and mixin behavior.
entry.content:
Variants are logically similar to mixins in their ability to modify a

test suite, with the difference being that a test spec is created for

each variant rather than all being applied to a single test spec. To

ensure more consistent treatment of fields, variants will now use the

mixin codepath to modify a test.



The following differences remain with variants:

* The enabled, identifier and mixins fields specify behavior that is

specific to variants.

* Skylab details can be specified on a variant under the skylab key.

When a variant is applied to a test, if the skylab key is present, all

fields of the value will be lifted to the top-level, except for the

cros_chrome_version field, which is only used by the cros skylab image

roller to compare against other data sources.



This CL introduces the following behavior changes:

* The swarming field in a variant is merged in the same way as with a

mixin, in particular, dimension_sets will be added to the test's

dimension_sets value instead of merging elements at the same index.

This didn't result in any changes to generated files, but all variants

have been updated to use dimensions instead of dimension_sets to

ensure the same behavior going forward.

* A mixin that specifies the description field (non exist at this

point), will have the description appended to any existing description

for the test.



Bug: 1456553

Change-Id: I869d8baad76027d811b7c3b96ed35d46509a819b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4703284

entry.title: Multiplanar: Change to 2D from OES for D3D texture creation
entry.content:
This change updates texture target from TEXTURE_EXTERNAL to TEXTURE_2D

in order to do perform copy and readPixels for multiplanar d3d11

textures using Angle api instead of performing copy in Skia first.



This can be done only when the D3D11_BIND_RENDER_TARGET bind flags

are provided by client and so without those flags it should continue

to use TEXTURE_EXTERNAL.



Also, update RGB to YUV converter in media to use NumTextures instead

of num planes to correspond to the right number of mailboxes with

multiplanar SI.

entry.title: [Extensions] Display IPH only on tab changes
entry.content:
Previously, IPH visibility was computed every time that the extension

controls were updated. This was problematic because IPH could be shown

at the same time as other dialogs. Instead, we should only show IPH

for tab updates (and after updating the content). This way if there are

any changes after the tab was updated (e.g ungranting an extension's

site access), IPH will not be shown until the tab is updated (meaning

IPH will not be shown under the reload bubble).



Screencast:

- Accepting reload bubble:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-5Zv_hhX3EGv217IIVx_f1K5J-NM11wO/view?usp=sharing

- Canceling reload bubble:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wSOoZtpK9EYDeqC3td2fEv_0CGMBfmI7/view?usp=sharing



Bug: 1357159

entry.title: Reland "[webauthn] Always filter passkeys by allow-list"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6516963bdf1c9ea51cccb74e3ec7947527ffcf30.



Reason for revert: relanding with fix for mac bots



Original change's description:

> gardening: Revert "[webauthn] Always filter passkeys by allow-list"

>

> This reverts commit a0e7eaa16dd8d6b9943e19c2098f2f77d376c6d2.

>

> Reason for revert: browser test is flaky on Mac

>

> Original change's description:

> > [webauthn] Always filter passkeys by allow-list

> >

> > When servicing a webauthn request, chrome requests discoverable

> > credential metadata matching the request from local authenticators.

> > These are filtered to match the request's allow list. However, GPM

> > passkeys are obtained directly from sync, so they are not being

> > filtered, which causes chrome to display passkeys that are not eligible

> > for the request.

> >

> > ChromeAuthenticatorRequestDelegate's credential_filter_ already filters

> > all credentials after they are discovered, but only for conditional

> > requests. This CL expands that behaviour to cover modal requests as

> > well, which fixes the bug.

> >

> > Bug: 1459273

> > Change-Id: I254a242b7c30ee8387c25c03a1bd8d0ca227d6d5

entry.title: [iOS][Toolbar] Add omnibox consumer in toolbar mediator
entry.content:
Omnibox needs to know the position of the unfocused omnibox for the

popup to animate into position.



When the omnibox is being focused from the bottom toolbar a fade in

animation is played. Thus, the popup needs to know the unfocused omnibox

position and if the omnibox is being focused. The later can be

approximated using IsZeroSuggest.



This CL:

- Creates ToolbarOmniboxConsumer to inform omnibox when its unfocused

position changes.

- Pipes this consumer from ToolbarMediator to OmniboxPopupMediator.

- Add omniboxPositionInToolbar and isZPS in OmniboxPopupPresenter.

entry.title: [Mac Sonoma Tests] Fix PreservedWindowPlacement.Test to run on macOS 14
entry.content:
This test created a window with origin {20, 30} and checked that it was

restored with that origin. In macOS 13, the menu bar is 38pts tall, so

this test placed the window beneath the menu bar. In macOS 14, it

appears the AppKit forces window restoration to respect the menu bar's

location, and so restores the window to {20, 38}. This cl changes the

window origin to {30, 40} to avoid the problem.



Test: out/Default/browser_tests --gtest_filter="PreservedWindowPlacement*"

The primary finch flag for PSTs is kPrivateStateTokens. In order to accommodate an ongoing finch experiment for the Fledge APIs, we split off kFledgePst. For clarity we are enabling both, but kFledgePst is redundant and will be removed shortly after.

entry.title: [iOS] contextMenuCoordinator stop
entry.content:
According to ChromeCoordinator invariant, all coordinators should be

stopped before being deallocated. This CL ensures that whatever the user chose, the coordinator is stopped; whether they tap a button or

dismiss by tapping outside (which call the cancel button)



In ActionSheetCoordinator, a cancel item is always added.

So adding this cancel element is not adding a new item, it’s only

ensuring it stops the coordinator

entry.title: [sync] Introduce infra to support custodian-disabled types
entry.content:
This patch reimplements https://crrev.com/c/4004869 in a way that the

functionality is now hosted in core sync layers, primarily

SyncUserSettings. It achieves four main things:



1) SupervisedUserPrefStore no longer manipulates the underlying pref

directly, which is considered private, and instead goes through

SyncPrefs, which also enforces that the type can only be

force-disabled (rather than force-enabled).



2) It reduces the risk that ongoing rewrites in SyncUserSettings and

SyncPrefs would cause regressions for supervised users, since it

is now explicitly part of the public API.



3) By introducing SyncUserSettings::IsTypeManagedByCustodian(), and

the corresponding plumbing to Java, it becomes more explicit why

ManageSyncSettings needs to consider the payments toggle

force-disabled (which previously had a subtle coupling with the

logic in SupervisedUserPrefStore).



4) ManageSyncSettings is generalized to honor this bit (whether or

not a setting is custodian-controlled) for all types, instead of

special-casing PAYMENTS. In practice, this makes no difference,

as currently only PAYMENTS may be custodian-controlled.



Bug: 1435427, 1451509

Change-Id: I043abd18c7f0a31000896361944722fef8564651

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687582

might have persisted from a previous run when the pref was syncable.

types are disabled (which is the case in signout).

entry.content:

Reason for revert: These tests are still failing on iOS 17 simulator https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/ios17-sdk-simulator



Original change's description:

> Updating and re-enabling EGTests for the Pinned Tabs.

>

entry.title: [iOS][LocationBar] Add omnibox switching actions to context menu
entry.content:
Add the actions to move the omnibox to top and bottom toolbar in the

location bar context menu.



When bottom omnibox is enabled:

- The context menu elements now has icons.

- All the copy/paste menu elements are in the same sections.

- Show Top/Bottom address bar action is in a separate section.

- The menu orientation depends on the location bar position.



https://www.figma.com/file/h4dhORq7ozEV5DldotDfFt/Bling-Bottom-Omnibox?node-id=630%3A124468&mode=dev



This CL:

- Adds a custom copy action so it can be grouped with the other paste

actions.

- Adds an image to existing paste actions.

- Adds the new "Show Top/Bottom Address Bar" actions.

entry.title: Enable dawn_use_built_dxc on Dawn Win x64 bots
entry.content:
This CL enables building DXC on Dawn bots and also enables it

by default on dawn_end2end_tests where available.



To maintain coverage of the FXC path, dawn_end2end_tests is run

with --disable-toggles=use_dxc on these bots as well.



The WebGPU CTS is run with --disable-dawn-features=use_dxc to

keep it on the FXC path. A future change will run the CTS using

DXC.



Note: DXC is not built on Windows x86 because the population of

clients on x86 with SM6.0+ (required for DXIL) is tiny, and

currently blocklisted for WebGPU.



Bug: 1462339

entry.title: Error close_promise of outgoing stream on error
entry.content:
If an outgoing stream from webtransport is closed,

a close promise is generated and a STOP_SENDING is send.

During the time of closing the stream, e.g. a session close can error

the stream, causing a close promise, that is never settled.

This patch addresses this issue and closes the promise with error.

Symptom of the problem is an outgoing stream close hanging forever.



R=ricea@chromium.org



Bug: 1455664

Change-Id: I9ea5c644095b514bec37383084fa4e389ebcbd3b

entry.title: DelayBasedBeginFrameSourceMac: Handle VSync parameter skew
entry.content:
The VSync parameters on macOS change over time. In compensation for

this, we re-compute them every 10 seconds (see the initial

implementation in crrev.com/343739).



This function to trigger to update update code wasn't copied

when creating DelayBasedBeginFrameSourceMac, re-introducing the the

VSync skew bug.

entry.title: Change device ownership retrieval in ChromeUserManager
entry.content:
This change fixes the problems with device ownership retrieval

outlined in go/async-ownership-retrieval.

Currently, the device owner is set everyt time

`RetrieveTrustedDevicePolicies` is called. This results in multiple

calls to `SetOwner` with a an invalid account id (since the owner wasn't

yet final). This change fixes the issue by decoupling setting the owner

and calling `RetrieveTrustedDevicePolicies`.



This CL furthermore renames `GetOwnershipAccountIdAsync` to

`RequestOwnershipAccountId`.



Bug: b/245337406, b/287416180

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*ApiGuardDelegateTest*"

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*UserManagerTest*"

entry.title: [ios] Rename WebStateSelection and add new fields/method to it
entry.content:
This CL

- renames WebStateSelection to WebStateListStatus because it has not only `index` that is updated in WebStateList but also the information of an active WebState and a pinned state. `kSelectionOnly` is renamed to `kStatusOnly` accordingly.

- adds `old_active_web_state` and `new_active_web_state` to WebStateListStatus. These will be used when replacing WebStateActivatedAt() with WebStateListDidChange().

- removes `active_state_change` flag and adds `active_web_state_change()` to check if the active WebState is updated based on the information of `old_active_web_state` and `new_active_web_state`.



The third update in the bullet points changes the test expectation in WebStateListTest::MoveActiveWebState. Previously, `active_state_change` could be true when an active WebState was moved. Now, `active_web_state_change()` always return false when an active WebState is moved because the move operation updates the index but not WebState itself.



Bug: 1442546

Change-Id: I18bc810fff46f7e7021ce34870226a0717bd92f8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687273

entry.title: [iOS] Enhanced and Standard Protection Setting UI Updates
entry.content:
These changes update the UI for enhanced and standard protection safe

browsing setting pages to show more of what enhanced protection has to

offer and remove outdated UI in standard protection.



Additionally, the mediator was removed and the logic was moved to

the enhanced protection view controller because there was no business

or model logic. The mediator was simply providing UI. This was an

incorrect implementation of our initial design pattern which was

seen as okay since we considered data passed to the VC as the model

which a mediator holds.



Afterwards, we realized that we were adding

more overhead by passing a property that was just going to be held

by the view controller anyway. If there was a case where UI items are

manipulated heavily through business logic, it would warrant putting

the objects in a mediator class, but there is no case of that here.



Bug: 1457655

Change-Id: I4ff9660e24a1e901cad728e142478d6ac87df286

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685459

entry.title: [GWP-ASan][LUD] Split slot metadata into two structs
entry.content:
Field experiments have shown that we practically never need more than 24

stack frames in the deallocation stack trace to diagnose a Lightweight

UAF Detector crash report. Additionally, LUD does not collect allocation

stack traces. Therefore, the combined stack trace buffer size used by

GWP-ASan by default is wasteful.



This CL introduces a new slot metadata struct kind with a reduced stack

trace buffer size. It also removes several fields that are specific to

only one of the two kinds.



Bug: 1418006

Change-Id: I48a8631bb981b19b5e5a563c17ad12ad9a7f978e

entry.title: [ios][web] Remove the web::BrowsingDataRemover class
entry.content:
The class web::BrowsingDataRemover has the same short name as the

class BrowsingDataRemover from //ios/chrome but is a completely

separate class.



Additionally, web::BrowsingDataRemover is never used directly, only

via web::ClearBrowsingData() function and does not have any state.

Thus it can be removed and the functionality moved directly to the

function itself.



This makes the code easier to understand as there is now only one

class named BrowsingDataRemover, and the functionality needed to

remove data from //ios/web is exposed by a simple function.



Fixed: 1465313

entry.title: Fix selection ring animation
entry.content:
This CL fixes a bug with the selection ring on drag&drop. Video of the

issue:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13R_ha8k4tzwviePQvkIJGE8uqCk-xc_D



This is due to a workaround that was introduced to make the ring appear

faster after the drop. Video of the "bug" where the ring is slow to

reappear:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13FDNfUvgQBNnVd6_QRpRbtmWH-Hn6Al-



Thankfully, iOS 16 fixed the drop bug:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13G_1Kb_TOHtigV34fiZbUvctZQpZORrw



So this CL is removing the previous workaround. On iOS 15, we still have

a slow to appear ring, but it's less important than the initially

mentioned animation issue.

entry.title: Manage SU Interstitial lifecycle on iOS
entry.content:
This change adds lifecycle management to the SU

interstitial. The interstitial instance is wrapped

inside an instance of an `IOSSecurityInterstitialPage`

in order to handle it's lifetime through the existing

logic in IOSBlockingPageTabHelper.



Only the parts relevant to the lifecycle handling are

implemented in `SupervisedUserInterstitialBlockingPage`.



If we decided to do so, we can further refactor the SU

interstitial in the future, to use more existing

functionality from the Security Interstitials classes.

entry.title: 💁 Give FlowControllers more control to trigger the end of the flow
entry.content:
The ProfileManagementFlowControllerImpl's API used to always trigger

the end of the flow when Step::kPostSignInFlow is completed. This

CL changes it to let the flow controller implementation provide itself

the callback that will trigger it, opening the possibility to do

something else.



This will be used in a follow-up CL to show another step after

Step::kPostSignInFlow in certain flows.

entry.title: Remove test callbacks from the MediaDevices object
entry.content:
MediaDevices had 3 callbacks.

- EnumerateDevices: rewrote the tests to verify the results of the

promise.

- DeviceChange: rewrote the tests using addEventListener and a

NativeEventListener.

- ConnectionError: this was used to verify that closing a mojo pipe

actually closed it. This verification is not needed in these tests. We

can assume that closing a pipe actually closes it. Correct mojo

behavior is tested elsewhere.



Drive-by: Replace some ASSERTs with CHECKs in helpers, since ASSERTs

there did not stop the test.



This CL is in preparation for improvements in handling of the devicechange event.
